name: Boehmeria phyllostachya
remarks: Type . . . not traced. There is a sheet at M with the¹inscription 'Villarica, Pohl 3698' which might be part of¹the type material. (see Opera Bot. 129: 18. 1996)

name: Pilea acanthoides
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364420X16033962925268 The name was chosen because of the similarity of the leaves with those from some Acanthaceae species.

name: Pilea brasiliensis
distribution: Brazil West-Central (Brazil, Southern America);Brazil Southeast (Brazil, Southern America);

name: Pilea carautae
distribution: Rio de Janeiro (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)

name: Pilea dendrophila

name: Pilea pubescens
reference: Kongel. Danske Vidensk. Selsk. Skr., Naturvidensk. Math. Afd. ser. 5, 2: 303. 1851

name: Pilea tenebrosa
distribution: Santa Catarina (Brazil South, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364420X16033962925268 The specific epithet is from 'tenebrosa', a Latin word meaning 'of shade', in allusion to the place where the plant was discovered and to the dark color of the stem and leaf adaxial surfaces.
